alert.note: Alert for Geneva; Houston (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 10 at 5:27PM CDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Geneva and southeastern Houston Counties in southeastern Alabama, Jackson, northeastern Bay, northwestern Calhoun, eastern Holmes and northeastern Washington Counties in the Panhandle of Florida through 600 PM CDT... At 527 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Graceville to 9 miles south of Chipley. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Cottonwood, Vernon, Chipley, Graceville, Bonifay, Marianna, Bradford, Malone, Cottondale, Greenwood, Altha, Alford, Wausau, Esto, Madrid, Campbellton, Noma, Bascom, Moose Pond and Grangeburg. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
